Thank you for your email.
It seems that you are making use of the Shadow files, which in time can get quite large.

The System Maintenance-Audit Log Backup menu contains 2 important sections:
1)Make Backup – which represents the possibility to perform a One time backup
2)Scheduler in the 2nd part of the Audit Log Backup menu, which represents the possibility to recreate exactly as for the One Time Backup an Audit that will run periodically, at a frequency chosen by you.
 
The steps are:

	You will have to select what kind of logs you want to backup:

 

 
 


	If  you intend to delete the logs and backup them, in order not to fill up the server, you will have to leave the following unchecked:


 
 


	Select how old logs to backup (in the following screenshot I chose 1 month old – this means that all the logs older then 1 month will be removed from Server and transformed into backups).

Select the number of logs in one package (you can leave the default 1 mil, or go even higher);
Select format;
Choose if you would prefer to delete and backup Shadows too. We encourage to include them as the shadows occupy more space then the logs and are main cause for server space fill up.
 
 

 
 
 
The Scheduler  is very important and should be set from the beginning, in order to avoid situations where  the Server gets filled with logs. The Audit backup packages will be available for download in the list from the bottom of the screen.
After you download them, you can simply delete them from the interface, as they still occupy space on the server.
The period for finishing an Audit log Backup depends on the number of logs and on the database size. When the One time backup  is done, the message from the top of the section,“Currently an audit log backup is running” will disappear

Hi Dinakaran,

Thank you for your email.
It seems that you are making use of the Shadow files, which in time can get quite large.
So we need to set up an Audit Backup in place- but for that to happen, we need free space available at least as much as the Shadow files- which are 14 GB in this case.

The System Maintenance-Audit Log Backup menu contains 2 important sections:
1)Make Backup – which represents the possibility to perform a One time backup
2)Scheduler in the 2nd part of the Audit Log Backup menu, which represents the possibility to recreate exactly as for the One Time Backup an Audit that will run periodically, at a frequency chosen by you.

The steps are:

  1.  You will have to select what kind of logs you want to backup:


[X]



  1.  If  you intend to delete the logs and backup them, in order not to fill up the server, you will have to leave the following unchecked:

[X]



  1.  Select how old logs to backup (in the following screenshot I chose 1 month old – this means that all the logs older then 1 month will be removed from Server and transformed into backups).

Select the number of logs in one package (you can leave the default 1 mil, or go even higher);
Select format;
Choose if you would prefer to delete and backup Shadows too. We encourage to include them as the shadows occupy more space then the logs and are main cause for server space fill up.


[X]



The Scheduler  is very important and should be set from the beginning, in order to avoid situations where  the Server gets filled with logs. The Audit backup packages will be available for download in the list from the bottom of the screen.
After you download them, you can simply delete them from the interface, as they still occupy space on the server.
The period for finishing an Audit log Backup depends on the number of logs and on the database size. When the One time backup  is done, the message from the top of the section,“Currently an audit log backup is running” will disappear

Hi Dinakaran,

Thank you for your email.
It seems that you are making use of the Shadow files, which in time can get quite large.
So we need to set up an Audit Backup in place- but for that to happen, we need free space available at least as much as the Shadow files- which are 14 GB in this case.
So, to summarize:
1.We need more soace- either we remove files form the server, or we increase the disk space
2.You set up- and I will show you below how, and Audit Log Backup and after you have the files archived you can download and delete them straight from the UI

The System Maintenance-Audit Log Backup menu contains 2 important sections:
1)Make Backup – which represents the possibility to perform a One time backup
2)Scheduler in the 2nd part of the Audit Log Backup menu, which represents the possibility to recreate exactly as for the One Time Backup an Audit that will run periodically, at a frequency chosen by you.

The steps are:

  1.  You will have to select what kind of logs you want to backup:


[X]



  1.  If  you intend to delete the logs and backup them, in order not to fill up the server, you will have to leave the following unchecked:

[X]



  1.  Select how old logs to backup (in the following screenshot I chose 1 month old – this means that all the logs older then 1 month will be removed from Server and transformed into backups).

Select the number of logs in one package (you can leave the default 1 mil, or go even higher);
Select format;
Choose if you would prefer to delete and backup Shadows too. We encourage to include them as the shadows occupy more space then the logs and are main cause for server space fill up.


[X]



The Scheduler  is very important and should be set from the beginning, in order to avoid situations where  the Server gets filled with logs. The Audit backup packages will be available for download in the list from the bottom of the screen.
After you download them, you can simply delete them from the interface, as they still occupy space on the server.
The period for finishing an Audit log Backup depends on the number of logs and on the database size. When the One time backup  is done, the message from the top of the section,“Currently an audit log backup is running” will disappear

Hi Dinakaran,

Thank you for your email.
It seems that you are making use of the Shadow files, which in time can get quite large.
So we need to set up an Audit Backup in place- but for that to happen, we need free space available at least as much as the Shadow files- which are 14 GB in this case.
So, to summarize:
1.We need more soace- either we remove files form the server, or we increase the disk space
2.You set up- and I will show you below how, and Audit Log Backup and after you have the files archived you can download and delete them straight from the UI

The System Maintenance-Audit Log Backup menu contains 2 important sections:
1)Make Backup – which represents the possibility to perform a One time backup
2)Scheduler in the 2nd part of the Audit Log Backup menu, which represents the possibility to recreate exactly as for the One Time Backup an Audit that will run periodically, at a frequency chosen by you.
 
The steps are:


	You will have to select what kind of logs you want to backup:

 

 
 


	If  you intend to delete the logs and backup them, in order not to fill up the server, you will have to leave the following unchecked:


 
 


	Select how old logs to backup (in the following screenshot I chose 1 month old – this means that all the logs older then 1 month will be removed from Server and transformed into backups).

Select the number of logs in one package (you can leave the default 1 mil, or go even higher);
Select format;
Choose if you would prefer to delete and backup Shadows too. We encourage to include them as the shadows occupy more space then the logs and are main cause for server space fill up.
 
 

 
 
 
The Scheduler  is very important and should be set from the beginning, in order to avoid situations where  the Server gets filled with logs. The Audit backup packages will be available for download in the list from the bottom of the screen.
After you download them, you can simply delete them from the interface, as they still occupy space on the server.
The period for finishing an Audit log Backup depends on the number of logs and on the database size. When the One time backup  is done, the message from the top of the section,“Currently an audit log backup is running” will disappear
